subject: Re: [junit] Re: testXXXX must return void?
msgSnippet: Start here: http://www.xprogramming.com/Practices/PracDoInInspector.htm If you ve never read this before, then it may help you understand our perspective. ...
messageBody:
Start here: http://www.xprogramming.com/Practices/PracDoInInspector.htm

If you've never read this before, then it may help you understand our perspective.

>So said areider on 2003-06-24 --------------------
>--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Wenner <robert@p...> wrote:
>> I am not sure if I got you right here.
>> Why do you use that inspector? To /manually/ verify the /automated/
>> test did not fail? Collecting test results (whether tests fail or
>pass) is JUnit's job, not the tester's -- that's why it is an
>automated test.
>
>I think we are coming from different places. Maybe its my Smalltalk
>background. I dont want to get too OT but maybe a specific example
>will help.
<snip />


J. B. Rainsberger,
